How can I use the `getidentitytrust` command with the Verus JSON-RPC API?

You can use the `getidentitytrust` command with the Verus JSON-RPC API by sending a JSON-RPC request with the following format:

```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getidentitytrust", "params": [["id1", "id2",...]]}' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```

Replace `"id1", "id2",...` with the actual IDs you want to retrieve ratings for, and `myusername` with your actual username.

getidentitytrust '["id",...]' Arguments "["id",...]"                    (strarray, optional) if specified, only returns rating values for specified IDs, otherwise all Result: {  "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...},    (jsonobj) an ID/ratings key/value object  "identitytrustmode":<n>              (int) 0 = no restriction on sync, 1 = only sync to IDs rated approved, 2 = sync to all IDs but those on block list } Examples: > verus getidentitytrust '["id",...]' > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getidentitytrust", "params": ['["id",...]'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
